New Records: Mitchell Marsh scored 177 not out, one of the highest scores in one-day international chases.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh's innings of 177 not out was a major performance.
David Warner and Steve Smith supported Marsh with consecutive century partnerships.
Marnus Labuschagne produced two run-outs, including a crucial one to dismiss Mahmudullah.
Australia beat Bangladesh by eight wickets.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh dedicated his performance to his late grandfather, expressing that he hoped it brought a smile to his family's faces.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia's opening bowlers struggled, allowing Bangladesh to reach 170 for two at one point.
Mitchell Starc was rested, and the rejig with Pat Cummins and Sean Abbott did not change the trend of early struggles.
Marnus Labuschagne has become one of Australia's most valuable fielders, contributing significantly in the field.
